website_summaries.verdict: Smaller design for a charcoal chimney, meaning it will fit small grills nicely.
pros: Inexpensive unit that performs well, especially when used with small grills
Uses a heat shield between the chimney and the handle to keep the handle at a safe temperature
Contains numerous slots to allow air flow from the bottom
cons: Metal in the chimney may not stand up to rough treatment, as it bends easily

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect chimney for lighting a small numbe of briquettes for those low and slow cooks... One full chimney equates to almost exactly 40 briquettes. In my photos you'll be able to see the comparison between this and the full size chimney. One full compact chimney will fill the full size chimney to about the top hole in the side (prob just under half a chimney). I see myself using this new compact version a LOT more than the full size.
customer_reviews.author: Sakie8015

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 18" Kettle and minion method
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order another chimney starter after having purchased the weber standard size starter. The standard starter is big and holds about 100 briquettes. This is great if using a full size grill. I however, travel with my 18" Weber and this compact starter is perfect and takes up much less room. I also use it when I only need 10 or so briquettes for slow smoking. I haven't noticed the handle getting hot because I use gloves when handling these starters and I think everyone should to avoid burns. Recommended. I added a photo so people can compare the size difference.
customer_reviews.author: CasaDeTrevino

customer_reviews.title: Great way to light your grill up right!
customer_reviews.text: Eliminates the need for lighter fluid. Just throw some news paper or paper towel underneath it, stack charcoal in the chimney and light the paper. Be patient and let it do it's job for 20-30 minutes, once it's done, simply dump into the grill and cook. If you need more charcoal than the chimney fits, I find it worthwhile to simply stack some unlit charcoal in the grill first, dump the ready charcoal from the chimey across the unlit charcoal and simply give it another 15-25 minutes to spread the fire across the unlit coals, and then cook. Great device, save money on eliminating the need for lighter fluid and eliminate the taste of the fluid getting to your food.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: This works very well. I do suggest using newsprint ...
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. I do suggest using newsprint (not just any paper, as other papers burn up too quickly, as I found out), and if you are using a full load of briquettes, then consider putting a half sheet of newsprint about halfway up---that seems to get the fire spread a bit quicker and more evenly. Be sure when crumpling your newsprint to leave some air room--if it's wadded up too tight it doesn't burn!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Diane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I own the large and small version of this chimney starter. The large chimney is used to start the charcoal for my 22" weber grill. The smaller version works perfectly for my smaller weber smoky joe.....it can also be used to start just a few briquettes to get the charcoal going in my 22.5" Weber Smokey Mountain smoker using the Minion method. Don't expect to start 1/2 a bag of charcoal with this smaller unit. It will work fine for <14" grills but for anything larger the bigger unit should be employed. Combine one of these chimneys with the wax cubes that Weber also offers to get things burning and you'll never want to use lighter fluid (or newspaper) again.
customer_reviews.author: Zeus

customer_reviews.title: Small, but you can cook on it!
customer_reviews.text: This Weber chimney starter is OK for camping because of it's small size. What is really convenient is that you can load it full of charcoal and place a pot over it like a burner. I would not have attempted this with a cheap non-Weber chimney. Remember this chimney is small, it will maybe start enough charcoal for a hibachi.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Tiny "Green" Version - Going in the Trash
customer_reviews.text: Hi - I don't know what you thought you were going to get - but this thing is literally 8" high, squinting. And it's something over 5" in diameter. WHAT you're used to, is 12" tall, ladies, with closer to 8" girth. Here's what I think. Some 20-something in marketing decided it would be a great idea if folks used less coal to make their stakes or salmon or whatever, so here's the result of that: the kid-size version. It's cute if you like cute. And maybe your daughter can use it on her easy-bake oven. For the rest of you who are more interested in lighting a fire, vote with your grill. Reject this piece of *^%.
customer_reviews.author: Infidell

customer_reviews.title: Melted handle
customer_reviews.text: This chimney works well enough, but the plastic handle is not heat resistant (not enough anyway) and begins to melt after several uses. Mine is still functional despite the melted handle, but I'm not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: bitsy

customer_reviews.title: Charcoal taking too long to catch fire?!?! NAH!!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS REVIEW IS FOR MY VERY FIRST TIME USING IT! GRILL, LIGHT CUBES & COMPACT RAPID FIRE. Followed the instruction and my charcoal caught fire ASAP!!! Yes I used the Weber light cubes and it started fire ASAP! I’ve ordered the small compact rapid fire for my little weber anywhere charcoal grill!! EVERYTHING WORKED! So far nothing got melted as previous seen on a video yet if you dont turn this little thing away from fire it’s obvious it will burn its made is plastic the handles after all. Once summer gets over I’ll post another review as to how well it’s performing but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mabel F.

customer_reviews.title: Not sufficient for small BBQ grills
customer_reviews.text: This chimney was described (by users) as adequate to produce enough hot coals for a small grill. Well, in my experience, not so. I have the small grill pictured (Weber Go-Anywhere Charcoal Grill), and this chimney produces enough hot coals to cover only about 1/2 of the grill area - enough for one steak, but not two. So buyer beware. If you don't mind heating a 2nd batch of coals and delaying your BBQ by 1/2 hour, then this is the chimney for you. On the other hand, I ended up buying the larger chimney which produces enough hot coals to cover the area of this small grill in one fell swoop.
customer_reviews.author: Bewilderedatman

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works
customer_reviews.text: This really does work. I split a full newspaper page in half and balled them up to put under the chimney starter. There was a little breeze so I wasn't very optimistic as I thought the wind would blow out the flame. It didn't. It lit the coals in no time. I don't know why I never tried this. I am kicking myself for not getting the larger starter. I just ordered the larger one, but I'm keeping this to use for smaller jobs. I highly recommend this if you have a small grill. I actually purchased these starters to reverse sear my steaks after i cook them sous vide.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Charmer

customer_reviews.title: Great for novice griller!  Cools off quickly.  Use it with the small table top Webber grill
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to grilling and I was getting frustrated with coals not staying hot using only lighter fuel or cubes alone. I saw my uncle (professional griller of the family) use one of these and bought one. It has significantly improved my grilling and I’m no longer frustrated. I use it with the Webber cubes. I have a smaller table top Webber grill (I think the Smokey Joe) and this works perfect with it. It also cools off quickly allowing me to store when I’m done grilling (10 mins later). I wish I had purchased this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Charcoal grilling for Lilliputians
customer_reviews.text: I suppose this is my bad. I’ll take the rap. Had I been more careful before I ordered, I might have noticed this charcoal starter is ludicrously, hilariously tiny. I typically use irregularly sized lump charcoal to fire our 18 inch Weber Smoky Joe ‘Premium.’ I would need to fill this dollhouse sized chimney three times to have enough charcoal going to grill a meal for two. So I’ll just keep on using my rusty old full sized Weber chimney starter, stuff this in the basement and chalk it up to experience. Hopefully you can benefit from my mistake. You have been warned!
customer_reviews.author: Chambolle

customer_reviews.title: Another great Weber tool
customer_reviews.text: A really great alternative to the electric starter I used to have. Just crumple some paper on the bottom underneath the charcoal holder, light it, and place on the charcoal grate. Within 15 minutes, you're ready to pour the hot coals in place. I tried the larger chimney, but felt it was too large. This size is just right to light up to about 20 pieces. I use a traditional 22 inch Weber grill primarily for smoking ribs or chicken. The small Weber chimney lights up just enough coals for starting a long smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy W.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this compact starter! It gets WAY more use than the "regular" sized chimney (AKA MAMMOTH). I mean, how often do you need your grill as hot as the surface of the sun? This is perfect for compact traveling grills like the Smokey Joe or Go Anywhere, the WSM or even a regular 22" kettle and it stores away easier than the behemoth version. Get one. Pro Tip: When cooking on a 22" kettle, one compact chimney full of lit coals and all your vents wide open, will peg your temp at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for hours. You're welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Small and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this little chimney starter for my husband to replace our poor, rusted, 7 yr old starter that practically was falling apart. Honestly, it wasn't 100% for my husband, as in my opinion, he makes the best, smoky delicious hamburgers over coal heat that I've ever tasted. I wanted to make sure that tradition continued by getting him a new chimney starter to help that process. It arrived bundled with other products undamaged, intact. It is a little smaller than the old starter, but it gets the job done just fine and we've learned our lesson: keep it out of the rain! It's been several weeks and not a spot of rust. Good price, good quality!
customer_reviews.author: HotPinkUnicornMessTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: The item description says this charcoal chimney is 5.75 inches high and 8 inches wide. That was the exact height that I needed so I ordered one. Silly me for not reading every single word of the contradicting item description because further on in the description it says dimensions are 8 H x 5.8 W x 10.4 D. This Weber charcoal chimney is less expensive and a better made product than some of the ones that I have seen in big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Player

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than most
customer_reviews.text: The chimney appears to be of sturdy construction and the floor that holds the charcoal above the paper chamber is a wire grill which also looks strong. However the cylinder is noticeably shorter and smaller in diameter than other brands. You might have to make 2 loads to get enough coals to grill on a standard sized Weber grill. It will work fine for a smoker where you can use it for a base fire to add smoking woods. I would not buy it again because of its small size. In fact I am going to find a way to add an extension to the top so it can hold more charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: Cletus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a regular Akorn grill.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Akorn but getting it up to temp without using lots of lighter cubes is a 30 minute exercise. This knocks a solid 10 maybe 12 minutes off that and makes for more even heat. It holds about 2lbs of Kingsford which will get the Akorn up to 425-450 for about 1 hour cooking time with the vents on 4 top, 2 bottom. I use some greasy leftover napkins/paper towels or just some of the charcoal bag to light it, works great. Also works great with lump charcoal, its even faster, gets raging hot in less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Blade

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I have a full size Weber chimney and it works great. This compact version does not. I lit both of them side by side. The full size one was ready before the little one even got going. Spend the extra $10
customer_reviews.author: Tapps

customer_reviews.title: Finally bought one of these, worth it
customer_reviews.text: Heating up charcoal with the oldschool pyramid technique is a joke compared to using one of these Chimney starters. I put it off for so long but finally used this, and it's great. It's so much faster, heats up the coals thoroughly, and it's so easy to spread them out once its ready. The Kingsford Fire Starters are a perfect companion. Just one of those little bundles is enough to light the coals. I'm done with pyramid stacks doused in lighter fluid. This chimney starter is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: RadGH

customer_reviews.title: I made a mistake. Weber suffers.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item three stars not because it is inadequate or defective but because I assumed it was larger than it is. There's a larger version, which I've should have purchased, but I didn't realize it at the time I made the purchase. The 7447 is large enough of small grills or hibachis but too small for a large grill. I plan to use it primarily to provide the hot coals to get a fire pit burning so it should be adequate for my needs. I just which I had known instead of pouncing at the low cost. My fault.
customer_reviews.author: asimov

customer_reviews.title: Good match for 14in Smokey Joe
customer_reviews.text: I use this to light charcoal briquettes for my little 14in Weber Smokey Joe grill. Filled to the top is probably about as much charcoal as you'd normally want to use in a 14in grill, but you'd probably want the full-size chimney for anything larger. It's pretty easy to use, but I had to experiment to see what kind of discard paper I should use to light it. Newsprint-type paper from grocery store ads, brown packing paper, and some stiff packaging that's like paper egg carton worked well. Copy paper and notebook paper did poorly, they smoke and smolder but don't give you a good flame to ignite the charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Heironimus

customer_reviews.title: Works reasonably well at lighting charcoal.
customer_reviews.text: We've not used one of these before however a friend recommended trying it. Wadded up some paper (no starter fluid) and placed unit on the grill with the wadded paper inserted into the bottom. , It took a little longer than expected to light off the charcoal, but it worked fairly well. The only drawback was the coals at the bottom were about 30% burned off before the top coals were fully lit. Handle did not get too warm so handling and dumping the coals into the pit was not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bayou Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good for small grills
customer_reviews.text: I own a Weber Jumbo Joe, also purchased on Amazon. This starter is good for the regular smokey joe. I use it to get starter coals going, but it works best if you are doing zoning. If you want the heat even, a full size chimney starter would be better for this one. I've started kicking it old school recently and just used sticks and paper in the very bottom and that doesnt require any additional purchase. It also gives you a reuse option for paper that would have gone in the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Good fire starter
customer_reviews.text: After watching so many videos on YouTube, I decided to give this a try because sooo many people recommended it. It didn't work at first, but 2nd time I tried, it worked like a charm. It wasn't clear as to how many charcoals would fit.... I would have bought the bigger size one to fill my 18" Weber Grill in one fill. More or less, it works and I can't complain that much.
customer_reviews.author: CBK

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller than i anticipated but it works well!
customer_reviews.text: I guess i should have known it was a bit small but it is working nicely! It has enough to fill a basket of coal. I was too tired of lighting my charcoal on a basket and waiting too long for it to turn half white.. Now with this it turns white in like 15 minutes! The size is nice though so that i can store it easily. I think overall this small one is the right choice as it is also portable to bring with you when your out camping or picnicing.
customer_reviews.author: henryy

customer_reviews.title: Works for a smaller grill
customer_reviews.text: Basically, it boils down to what size grill you have. If you have a smaller charcoal grill and are only cooking for 2-3 people, then this size will work fine. If you have a larger grill, and cook for more than 4 people, then you will need to buy the larger chimney. And if you're still using lighter fluid to light loose charcoals you're missing out. Chimneys like this are a breeze. It only takes 10-15 minutes and the charcoal is ready. Keep in mind that the entire charcoal does not have to be white! Just wait until the flames are shooting up and the top charcoal is just starting to turn white and then pour into your grill.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Weber Coal starter Warning Sharp Edges
customer_reviews.text: Ok well let's try the review again without hurting sensitive feelings. The Weber Charcoal starter was a wonderful product, now made in China. But the edges are so sharp I required stitches after running finger across the top while inspecting my newly BOUGHT product. The charcoal heats up much faster using it, but you should file the edges down so your family does not get cut. Solid construction, but poor quality control. Buy American
customer_reviews.author: David Storm

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size for non-party use. If you ...
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for non-party use. If you have a grill that isn't giant, such as a Weber or other brand kettle style grill, you don't need a full load of the regular size chimney to just cook a few burgers for two people. Sure, you can fill the large chimney halfway, but filling this one all the way seems to light much more efficiently (much faster, and coals are hotter and more uniformly lit). And of course it's much easier to store than the large size. Unfortunately I need both sizes, for when I'm cooking for more people. With the small size, it's much easier to place coals precisely with this chimney.
customer_reviews.author: aaroncgiTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my 18in Weber Kettle. It holds about 30 briquettes. That's enough for about one half the grill in a single layer, which is perfect for grilling with a hot side and a cool side. It took about 20 minutes for 30 briquettes to fully light in this. It was easier and simpler than piling up the briquettes and using lighter fluid, and I also use fewer briquettes because I only light the ones I need, I don't have to use extra just to make the pile large enough.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small grills
customer_reviews.text: This chimney came in very handy during my labor day cookout. I got the compact one because I thought my grill wouldn't need the regular size but I should have gotten the bigger one. This compact chimney is great for small grills with less than 350 sq ft. It takes a few minutes to burn up but I used lighter cubes and newspaper to help it light up faster. After using this one, I can definitely say I'll get the bigger sizes one.
customer_reviews.author: Sus.An

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy method to start charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: Very quick way to get coals started, wish I had one sooner. I use this to start my mini charcoal grill and am able to set it up in 5 mins and coals are hot and ready to cook within 15 minutes. Just make sure to place the starter on the further end rather than in the middle of a mini grill because the handle sticks out and may touch get too close to edge of the grill, causing it to get charred.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McDermott

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have the larger one of these and Weber actually makes the best one of these. I have a Weber kettle grill and a big smoker and use the big one of these with regular charcoal and wood and it works great. I also received recently a kamado grill similar to big green egg and use coconut charcoal but only 4 or 5 chunks at a time. The big one fails miserably for that but this little guy works great for this task. Love to multitask tools but for this I need both. Thanks Weber for making size specific. This also would work great for tailgating and small smokey joe.
customer_reviews.author: edmocon

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Like the headline says, this thing is AWESOME! Had my charcoal hot in minutes with no nasty lighter fluid. VERY high quality for the money. My last chimney starter was 2x the cost and not nearly as high quality!! The handle is far enough from the chimney to resist heat and the handle keeps you from getting burnt. Very sturdy and well made, this thing is going to last for a long time! Very pleased with my purchase and would definitely recommend to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi B

customer_reviews.title: Best way to start plain charcoal in 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We use Walmarts Expert Grill charcoal, 16 lbs for a little over $5. I found that using one piece of paper in the bottom and then drip a little Veg Oil on the paper. Add a empty toilet paper roll in the middle and put the charcoal around it that makes a hole after it burns away that gets the charcoal ready quicker. The handle doesn't get hot. just warm. If you start it then go and get all the fixings the charcoal will be ready.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W Gleckner

customer_reviews.title: These things work GREAT
customer_reviews.text: They last and last and work fantastic. No need for charcoal lighter ever again. Everybody I ever see still using charcoal lighter gets one for their next birthday or Christmas or just as a thanks. This one is the smaller version. I often use the little Smokey Joe or the 18" weber and only fill the standard model 1/2 to 3/4 up or those. The chimney is a little more efficient when full, so I added the smaller one to my bbq tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: Hold

customer_reviews.title: Works well with the Weber Go-anywhere grill
customer_reviews.text: Got this little guy to pair with the Weber go-anywhere grill for some camping trips. Works great! It fills the grill about half way, which is fine for me as space saving is more important. If you have a larger grill, you should consider the larger size chimney.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Good for a small chiney starter
customer_reviews.text: Got this to go with our Weber Smokey Joe gold, and it's about the right amount of coal for that. PROTIP: spray/splash a bit of cooking oil on two sheets of newspaper (or grocery store ads, whatever) and it lights charcoal like a champ. I wasn't doing the oil before and it'd take 4 sheets leaving a ton of nasty paper ash before the coals took off; total user error. Takes about 20-30m to start a full chimney to the point all the coals are covered in white ash and ready to cook.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: MUST Have
customer_reviews.text: If you use a chimney, and if you use a WEBER, you need this. I can never tell you how much you will appreciate a chimney, and how much you will appreciate a Weber chimney above all others. If you never used one - buy it and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: break_fix

customer_reviews.title: For Small Grills Only
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for small grills – like the 14 inch Weber Smoky Joe. It does not have the capacity for larger grills. We use charcoal rather than briquettes (for favour and because we don't like the unknown binders and additives used in briquettes). Because of the uneven shapes found in bagged charcoal, we sometimes have to pack. the starter to the very top (and maybe a little bit higher), but nonetheless it works well for us. It seems to be well-made, and the heatshield in front of the handle is quite effective. Additionally, the handle is easily gripped.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Great product - buy the larger model
customer_reviews.text: Works very well but I should have bought the larger model. The only downside is the space at the bottom where you are supposed to put wadded up newspaper is so tight, even a half sheet of newspaper is cramped and doesn't allow enough room for a good burn. The larger model would be better I think. The handle can get HOT as the charcoal gets going. I use actual hardwood charcoal, not briquettes, though.
customer_reviews.author: NMSUAggies

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a regular charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: It works fine and does start charcoal better than piling. However, this one is too small for a standard grill. I still use it but spread the coals over HALF the grill. If I need to cook for 3 it's fine. Anything larger than that and I have to do 2 batches and makes the timing more complicated than necessary. Buy a larger one and save yourself the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: stephen k.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but VERY Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This gets the job done, but it is very flimsy and will most likely only last a few seasons. In order to make it last you'll have to pack it away in a VERY safe place. We stored it in our general trailer compartment and the bump roads dinged, dented, and crumpled it. We had to straighten it out after every trip. I would hope it could hold up on a trailer on a bumpy road, but alas.
customer_reviews.author: Hark

customer_reviews.title: Love mine!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using chimneys for many years to start my charcoal for the many fires I have used to char animal flesh for eating. My last one just finally gave up and fell apart. This is a great replacement and and works extremely well. Just used it for the first time and I am totally happy with it. If you are not using a chimney to start your charcoal, you are losing time and using too much charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: S. rakowitz

customer_reviews.title: I'm sold on charcoal grilling and this beats lighter fluid
customer_reviews.text: After buying a weber WSM smoker and a weber master touch for full size/larger grilling using a full size weber chimney, I bought this for my smokey joe and a camping trip. This is the perfect size and fit much better with our camp gear. I don't like the taste of lighter fluid so I just use this and the 2 weber compressed paper cubes and the charcoal lights perfectly everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it's supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Webber Smokey Mountain. It does exactly what I purchased it for. I fill it with charcoal, I light it from below and then the charcoal lights and in a little bit, it's ready to put with the rest of the unlit charcoal. It's not rocket science. . . But it doesn't need to be. It's not as heat resistant ans I would have expected, but it's heat resistant enough to not melt off my hand!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: who knew you needed a chimney?
customer_reviews.text: Gone are the days struggling to build a perfect pyramid of charcoal briquettes by hand. This device is totally amazing. Light up one of those waxy fire-starting cubes, fill this with briquettes, and place it on top. Within a very short period of time, you're ready to grill. Whoever invented this must have been good in Physics class. Having never taken the course, I'm grateful to you, wherever you are.
customer_reviews.author: Blanche de Navarre

customer_reviews.title: This is a great gift for anyone in your life who likes grilling ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift for anyone in your life who likes grilling with charcoal! My husband has started grilling more frequently and he loves this gadget. It makes firing up the grill much easier on days when the weather isn’t ideal - if it’s a little windy or cold. He has gotten so much use out of this grilling tool. It’s simple to use, sturdy, and has saved him time. No complaints and would buy it again in a heartbeat. It’s obviously not absolutely necessary for grilling, but it has been so helpful that he wouldn’t want to be without it now.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Bad for love, great for grillin!
customer_reviews.text: Well, the girl I gave this to broke my heart but I don’t think this fine piece of hardware would ever do that to you. It works great and was the basis for grilling some of the best food I’ve made in awhile. Keep in mind, this is a smaller version so takes a little more messing with but works great for smaller footprints. Just give the fire starter a little space and it will burn just how you want it to. If you really want something to work quickly and right away I’d go for the larger one but for smaller apartments where you are worried about storage, this still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brantigan

customer_reviews.title: everyone can be a pyromaniac
customer_reviews.text: Super easy and reliable. 1. lightly roll up couple sheets of newspaper 2. pack newspaper roll into chimney in the shape of a ring, leaving the center open or loosely packed 3. load charcoal into chimney 4. set loaded chimney onto grill 5. ignite newspaper ring at a couple (2-3) evenly spaced spots 6. enjoy beverage 7. when flames shoot out the top and the upper charcoal pieces start to glow, pour charcoal out into grill

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Good size for a grill, but you will need something larger for bbq/smoking. Works best if you use 1 piece of newspaper at a time, i.e., put 1 piece, let it burn out, and if the coals aren't smoking repeat the process. Filling the chimney to the top gives enough coals to sit under about 4 burgers or 2 steaks/chops. Of course you can add more coals after you dump the lit ones on your grill. This chimney does light faster than cheaper ones I have had, and the design makes it comfortable to handle.
customer_reviews.author: paxpaz

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy, well made. Only issue is that they could have made openings on the bottom a bit smaller, so smaller pieces of coal don't fall through. Also its pretty small. The size is disclosed, however it is a bit small for most peoples needs, a normal sized bbq (around 10-15 people). The handle insulates you from the heat quite well, so I never have worries about burning myself with this. Be warned that obviously since you are dealing with high heat, the metal and edges will get charred and discolored, but it doesn't affect the function at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: High quality that you would expect from Weber
customer_reviews.text: If you aren't using a chimney starter to start your charcoal, you are missing out. It is way easier than using lighter fluid. You also don't get that "lighter fluid taste" that goes along with it. Simply put some newspaper in the bottom, pour your charcoal on top, then light the paper. 20 minutes later your coals are ready. It's that easy. This is my second chimney starter. My first one was smaller and I was frustrated that it wasn't large enough. This one is larger. I sometimes use the smaller one when I don't need as many coals. This one is definitely higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Weber Product
customer_reviews.text: I have for many, many years purchased Weber products because they simply last and are made extremely well. I already own the larger model and just bought the smaller On the Go Charcoal Grill so got this size to match with. As my other chimney starter this is has good and a perfect smaller size to fit in the RV- Made well and should hold up as well - Other one is over ten years old and still burning!
customer_reviews.author: f.s.study

customer_reviews.title: Worthless and tiny.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most useless piece of crap ive ever bought. It get the coal really juce and ready, as long as u spend 5 min to get the thjbg started. In which xase i could just spray some light fluid on a stack on the grill. Oh and its so small i cant magine ud be able to cook more than 1 hot dog with the amount of caols that fit in this.
customer_reviews.author: Adina

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a Weber chimney starter
customer_reviews.text: I love this starter, but I wish I'd bought a larger one. My fault. Great handle for keeping the heat away from your hand. Easy to use and start. Still holds a lot, but I often need the larger version for what I'm using it for. Still, it's great for what it was meant for. I'm going to buy the larger version as well because of how well Weber designs these.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Grate in the center isn't smart - or a proper design
customer_reviews.text: The 'can' should be open to the floor of the grill. Lifting up a can full of hot coals and then having to dump them is dangerous and unsafe. Without a grate in there, you would simply lift the can up and would have control over spreading the coals vs. pouring them. No need to return. I've made the proper modification that works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CoinClocks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size for quick burns!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Oklahoma Joe’s longhorn combo 3-1. The smoker is pretty small compared to the firebox, so a full size chimney of coal would send me into 300 degree plus for 2 hours. This little guy is the perfect size for quick grilling and to keep a smaller amount of coals burning for long smokes. Great size, great quality as always. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Jkhouri

customer_reviews.title: Fires up fast and hot - Maybe too small
customer_reviews.text: First attempt I placed the chimney in the bottom of my Weber kettle. It took 20-30 min before coals were ready. Second time I placed it on the ground in campfire pit. It fired up quick and hot. Probably 10 min. I bought this small size for traveling to campsites. With just the two of us it seems it will be enough coals - just enough for a couple servings of meat.
customer_reviews.author: Diane C.

customer_reviews.title: Excited to try...
customer_reviews.text: Have t received yet but I’ve got a mini Weber grill that use rarely. Decided to go with the real hardwood charcoal to avoid additives. I see someone complained that no one has newspapers anymore. Well make your own firestarters. Everyone uses toilet paper, right. And drys clothes. Collect the lint from your dryer, highly flammable, and stuff into toilet paper tubes. TaDa! Perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Sackrison

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start, works good.
customer_reviews.text: Can't hold on to it very long when trying to dump the coals. The handle is good, but too close to the cannister... I have to dump coals quick, then typically drop the entire metal item onto the gravel quickly to avoid the pain/heat. It does work good, very easy to start the grill/charcoal with only 5 pcs of paper and a match.
customer_reviews.author: Robr

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: For all my grilling years never used one of these. Was told they work. Tried this, using newspaper. two sheets and whoopi, the charcoal is going, Takes about 10min to get all though the bricks, and it is "green". If you haven't use this for your charcoal try it. Don't know how long it will last, mine just sits out in the weather. This is the right size for smaller grills. When it rots i will buy another
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great for starting coal for cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for starting my coals too be used with my cast iron cooking. I like the fact I can start enough coals to start cooking (count out the number of coals you need for lid and under the kettle) and get second batch going off too the side for longer cooking times. I've cooked chili , Tator-tot hot dish, biscuits, bread, you name it and its so easy to manage your heat and not wasting extra coals. I don't travel without it.
customer_reviews.author: Ric K

customer_reviews.title: Dont Pack Tight
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to these and I love it. I would never NOT use these again when starting the grill. Took a little to learn the right way to pack newspaper in it. DONT pack tight, pack loose. Tight packing seems to cause the first to die out and the coals not getting lit properly. I'm sure its air flow related. Regardless, its a great pickup if you use a charcoal grill. NO FLUID!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie D

customer_reviews.title: Great grilling tool!
customer_reviews.text: We have used these cylinders over the last decade and find this tool to be a great help in starting the charcoal without using fluids. We just use it with our charcoal and a small cellophane packet of starter that makes it so easy. We do a lot of outdoor cooking, so we tend to use them up. They last 1-2 years when you grill often.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works well.
customer_reviews.text: We use our charcoal grill about once a week (twice if I'm lucky) and I don’t care for the lighter fluid smell, with this, I wad up one page of newspaper, drop in the charcoal and light the paper. Within just a few minutes the fire is going and there is no chemical smell. After the charcoal is burning well, the heat shield and handle protect my hands from the several hundred degree heat. If you love your Weber grill, this is a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Tadlock

customer_reviews.title: Handle melted
customer_reviews.text: I love these Weber Chimney Starters. I have more than one of them. I bought this one to use while at the beach. I put in the Briquets, lit the newspaper and waited about 30 minutes. When I returned the handle was melted. I could not pick it up so I just knocked it over. I used a metal hook to pick it up and put in the sand. Notified seller who authorized a refund. None of my other Weber Chimney Starters have ever done this.
customer_reviews.author: NEIL HINESTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this size over the larger version. I use charcoal a lot, I usually buy it around holidays when it goes on sale and I usually buy at least 100 pounds at a time. I rarely need enough charcoal to justify the larger version and with a small amount the larger version does not do as good a job. I take it camping and use for Dutch oven cooking and I use it at home on my Weber when I smoke or grill. Great little item and a must have for charcoal cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Martins

customer_reviews.title: Kind of small
customer_reviews.text: This is smaller than expected. Wish it were 30% larger, then I could fill a normal grill with the right amount of charcoal. Right now, I have to fill it, light it, then add two handfuls of charcoal more after I dump it out. The metal is thin... And is already warped from the heat. Wish it were a bit sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Will Phan

customer_reviews.title: Works really well and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Wow - - this is like magic! The coals fit my bbq with a 15.5x17" grill perfectly, if I overfill the chimney a bit. I've never had so much success in starting charcoal, and it started my mesquite charcoal chunks just as well. Just make sure you check your coals at 10-15 minutes, to make sure they don't get "overdone!"
customer_reviews.author: mla

customer_reviews.title: Makes charcoal grilling much more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: This makes lighting charcoal so much faster, we've grilled out more this summer than ever before. I can't believe I never tried one before. This more compact design works well with my smaller grill, and helps to get the right measure of charcoal every time. It seems to be well made, but is showing some signs that it may rust out at some point. Put it away in a dry storage area after it's cooled and not in use to slow the corrosion process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well | Already Starting to Warp
customer_reviews.text: I really like this contraption because it works well to get the coals started quickly and evenly. However, after just two uses it's already started to warp quite a bit. It looks like the metal isn't quite heat resistant enough for long term use. Depending on how much you grill, this looks like a one season tool at best. But, I've only used it twice, maybe it will surprise me. It has definitely been useful in getting the grill going quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kate E. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: (its not bad, but if you match something same price and ...
customer_reviews.text: wish it was a little bigger, you may have to fill it up twice, and the metal gets weak/warped kind of quick, (its not bad, but if you match something same price and read reviews, you might be able to do better) I have it and am using it, so just didn't want to over-rate for people who don't read :)
customer_reviews.author: WeLikeToBuy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, plastic handle hasn't melted, good design
customer_reviews.text: So tiny but so perfect! I've started a few charcoal fires in the past couple of weeks and this thing has worked perfectly. You may be worried about the size as it's a bit smaller than expected (compact in the title) but I found it just the right size for BBQ on my grill. If you need a ton of charcoal at once, maybe look elsewhere but I think you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Neiswender

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Than I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived the day after I placed my order. I like how fast it arrived, but I was a little bit disappointed at the size. It's a little on the small side so I went out and purchased an electric charcoal lighter instead. I'm glad I did. I have not used this but I'll hang onto it just in case. Not much room to stuff newspaper in the bottom AND add charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: Joe La

customer_reviews.title: Great chimney charcoal starter
customer_reviews.text: My Pit Barrel Cooker is rather small in diameter and this Weber Chimney fit nicely inside,... to tilt and drop the lit coals when deep inside the barrel. Larger chimney models force you to drop the lit coals from outside and above the barrel, creating a potential fire situation where burning sparks can be carried, and land on the surrounding dry vegetation. THAT,.. I DON'T NEED!!
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeyedude

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: It's just doesn't hold enough coals even for my small portable camping BBQ. As a result, it doesn't give you enough cook time for anything more than hot dogs. Otherwise it works as described and makes it much easier to get your coals going. Buy the bigger one and you will probably be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Marvin Wall

customer_reviews.title: Get the taller chimney for 18' or above grills
customer_reviews.text: The short chimney works great for small grills. If you have a 18' grill or bigger your going to want to get the taller chimney. Spend the extra if you have a bigger grill. It will save to about 20 min of heating up your bed of coals.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G.

customer_reviews.title: really it's for portable grills. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Weber Go-Anywhere charcoal with the Craycourt cast iron Go Grate. This holds a little more than what it takes to fill up the Go Anywhere. Not for a full-sized grill. I wanted something small to transport and store easily... this fits the bill. Small campfire style fire pit, portable grill.... it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: NameBetterThanYours

customer_reviews.title: Smaller is not better.
customer_reviews.text: The area for paper to be placed beneath the charcoal should be a minimum of 4-5” to allow the briquettes to ignite. This smaller version does not work as well as the larger size. I ended up purchasing charcoal lighter fluid instead of using paper packed up under the charcoal. I would return this but it is discolored now.
customer_reviews.author: Barb K

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm pleased with this chimney
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the 3# coffee can I've been using for years. Decided to step up to a "real" charcoal chimney. So far, it seems to work well, lots of air flow and all the charcoal ignited and got hot (something that did not always happen with my coffee can chimney). Overall I'm pleased with this chimney. Weber seems to be a product you can count on for function and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 pages of newspaper starts your bbq
customer_reviews.text: Fold 2 pages of news out to 1 long sheet. Roll them up, wrap around your hand, stuff in bottom of chimney. fill the top with coals of choice. Light it up, hold it up. When paper burning well, place on bbq. When coals have stopped flaming out the top, dump em, spread em out, cook. Handle can get hot, so prepare for that.
customer_reviews.author: Mr quick fix.

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: It works well and turns coals gray as quickly as expected but it’s a lower volume than i anticipated (it holds 30 Kingsford Blue briquettes) and...the moment I picked it up I burned my index knuckle on the upper part of the metal handle. I’ve never burned myself on a briquette chimney before this.
customer_reviews.author: Amozing

customer_reviews.title: Pretty small
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize this was a miniature version. My own fault since I didn't read in detail. Would be great for camping, or cooking on a normal Weber for only a couple people, but if you plan to use this to fill the whole grill, you'll have a hard time. It's about 60% the size of the 'normal' sized ones. Otherwise, it's fine and built well.
customer_reviews.author: David Modica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chimney
customer_reviews.text: The easiest, cleanest way to light charcoal. No muss, no fuss. Coals ready to go in about 10 minutes. I use a small piece of fire starter...some sawdust and wax molded into small "puck" shape. Suggest checking You tube for home made fire starters. There are many good "recipes."
customer_reviews.author: SoCalBill

customer_reviews.title: Buy a bigger one
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize when I bought this that it was "compact". Yea it is about half of the size of a regular chimney. Wish I would have seen that before m purchase. So I ended up buying a regular one at Walmart for half the price and threw this one away. I had to do two rounds just to do one bbq.
customer_reviews.author: Terri M

customer_reviews.title: It's small
customer_reviews.text: Its large enough for food for 2 people on a grill unless you eat a lot. It has already bent some from the heat. A lot of people I bet buy this thinking it is bigger like the other ones. I would say it is good as an add on in case you need more charcoal because its small and lights fast.
customer_reviews.author: Double R

customer_reviews.title: ... enough for 3-4 people and this size fits the perfect amount of coals for that grill
customer_reviews.text: I just have a tiny tabletop grill which i can grill on enough for 3-4 people and this size fits the perfect amount of coals for that grill. It's really just filling it up with coals, soak a paper towel in vegetable oil, put that in the lower part of the chimney, light it and after 15-20 minutes all the coals are evenly hot, even in the winter with snow outside. It's faster than standard way of lighting coals, plus i don't need lighter fluid anymore. This Chimney has already paid for itself. I have used a chimney before that didn't have enough airflow, but there is plenty here. As said, i've started this in 25 degree weather just fine.
customer_reviews.author: dingsda

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for any lump or briquitte charcoal griller. Much easier than other methods I have tried, plus no fluid. Just a little paper under it and it's away! It is a good size for a 20" kamado grill with lump charcoal if you want a grill session for some pizzas or burgers. If you need a long session, this may not be enough but you could always add more to the grill.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: great grilling tool
customer_reviews.text: wow just a great size for smokey joe BBQ , its made for a small charcoal griller so make sure ya know its for smokey Joe i have both the full size most folks think of when they grill and small smoky joe people often ask why two chimney , well i grill a lot and its just easier when i need the rt amount of hot coals when Im grilling outside ..
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a couple months. Super easy to use. It is compact so if you need a big set of coals go up a size but I like binging able to use a smaller amount since i do not need the whole grill full of coals. Only downside is it is showing some rust after several months of use but nothing that effects the preformance and nothing has fallen off or broken. Like it
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah R

customer_reviews.title: its okay, it could be better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I wanted something that would help me ignite my wood faster and something quick, but this one takes way too long and yes it does the job, it will heat up your charcoal and your wood, but it takes more than 25 minutes for me. The amount you can put in is not very much and maybe I should get the bigger one for more air travel and more wood to put in. Overall its good for someone that is bbqing for just themselve and not for a big group.
customer_reviews.author: Migel Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Does what it claims. Don't close the cover of the grill while this thing is working: the concentrated heat will burn the paint off!
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: Not Too Small at All - Very Solid and Well-Made
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived, and I'm impresses with both the quality and the size - was worried it might be too small to use with my new 22" CharBroil Kettleman cooker, but the Kettleman has a very shallow coal area which requires less charcoal than most other BBQ cookers, so this will be perfect. (We will be using this and the Kettleman in the Philippines, in a region where we can't get charcoal briquets - we use coconut shell charcoal instead, and it works great.) Looking forward to this Weber Compact starter helping with our outdoor cooking!
customer_reviews.author: MMSMCA

customer_reviews.title: Best way to light Charcoal
customer_reviews.text: We've always used charcoal grills and the Weber chimney starters are the way to go. This cute little compact one would be perfect for the smaller charcoal grills. I was actually thinking it was a shorter one that would fit inside the grill with the lid on, which it does, but it's much too small for our larger Weber grill. We'll stick to our standard size chimney starter! I would most definitely recommend this to anyone who uses a charcoal grill. No stacking coals. No nasty flavored lighter fluid. And, it's so fast!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal S

customer_reviews.title: Good option for small charcoal jobs
customer_reviews.text: Good option for small charcoal jobs. It is adequate for about four steaks or equivalent. It can be tricky to get the charcoal going. I have settled on a method of quartering a single sheet from the newspaper, wadding the pieces into four balls and making sure to leave a chimney hole at the center. This works most of the time but occasionally requires a second try. I still like it better than the standard, large Weber model when cooking for four or less.
customer_reviews.author: W. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Before this purchase it took forever to get the grill up and running without using selflighting charcoal. Not I put 2 pieces of crumpled paper and fill it up with charcoal and the rest is taken care of by the chimney. No need to keep an eye on it, no need to keep fanning it.
customer_reviews.author: resident

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! It’s bigger than I thought. Any bigger and it would be too big. It works great! I do suggest that you leave the briquettes in longer than you think you need to. Our first attempt we didn’t. They need to be in there for a good 15-20 mins to fully get going.
customer_reviews.author: tashat

customer_reviews.title: Nice but get bigger one
customer_reviews.text: The product works well, it does get hot when you try to flip bricks so makes sure you use a mitt or towel. I have an 18” grill and it was just way too small . I had to add an additional load . My suggestion is get the bigger one because you can alway subtract from it but the small one you can’t add
customer_reviews.author: Suavesito
